result.execSummary:
The defendant Marsheya O Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: The Court granted Huber privileges for work, school, and childcare.
*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation including full payment of restitution.

miscConds.notes: Court set restitution at $7,700.00 payable to Walmart. Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and restitution by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.

Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and restitution by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.
- Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- Court ordered no contact with Walmart on S. 27th St, A.R., M.R., and "The Waters" Retirement Facility.

timeConds.notes: With Huber release for work, school, and childcare IMPOSED AND STAYED.  The Court will permanently stay condition time if the defendant pays at least $500.00 towards restitution by September 9, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marsheya O Grant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marsheya O Grant in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  The Court granted Huber privileges for work, school, and childcare.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 30 DAYS condition time with Huber release for work, school, and childcare IMPOSED AND STAYED.  The Court will permanently stay condition time if the defendant pays at least $500.00 towards restitution by September 9, 2022. 
- Court ordered no contact with Walmart on S. 27th St, A.R., M.R., and "The Waters" Retirement Facility. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 50 hours of community service. 

*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation including full payment of restitution.

Court set restitution at $7,700.00 payable to Walmart.  Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and restitution by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 


20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Marsheya O Grant in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marsheya O Grant in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer A. Schnering. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alan R., Mary R, "The Waters" Retirement Facility

Defendant Marsheya O Grant in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/22 @ 2p
